comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Juichi Soyeda and Tadao Kamiya COMES TO COUNSEL JAPANESE HERE; Dr. Soyeda Sure That in the End Californian Situation Will Be Settled Amicably. "The Japanese are much surprised by the attitude of the Californian Legislature, and some of them are annoyed, but the thinking persons in Japan trust that the trouble will be solved in the light of justice and humanity," Dr. J. Soyeda said yesterday at the Hotel Astor. ... Dr. Soyeda and Tadao Kamiya who is associated with him in his mission, were entertained at a luncheon yesterday by the Publishers Association of New York ... Source: June 26, 1913, Thursday; New York Times Link: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9D04E5D6103CE633A... I have started a Wikipedia entry for him: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juichi_Soyeda

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Richard Arthur Norton:  Thank you for your information on Juichi Soyeda and Tadao Kamiya. It is great to have their full names and some idea of why they were in the news at the time. We will add some of the information to the description when we update the database.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Date inscribed on photo negative: 6-22-1913. They were here to lobby against the racist California Alien Land Act of 1913. So was Mr. Iijima:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3774619455/]
